intro: Eleutherococcus giraldii, commonly known as the Siberian ginseng, is a shrub native to the cold climates of eastern Russia and northern China. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces red berries that contain seeds, and it is often cultivated for its adaptogenic properties. Its botanical features make it well-suited to thrive in harsh, temperate environments.
